choices.A: Use a field of Number to count the number of seconds elapsed between two tasks
choices.D: From the Timers tab of the playbook task, choose the action for the timer and the timer field to perform the action on
choices.B: After the playbook has run, calculate the total time taken and set the timer field with this value
choices.C: To begin counting time taken, add a task in the playbook with automation startTimer. To end the counting, add a task with automation stopTimer

questions.question_text: Which two statements describe how timers are configured to start and stop automatically in a playbook? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
it should be CD
C as in Cardi B and D as in DBot

choices.B: Edit the incident layout to add a new button that calls the AssignToMeButton automation with argument assignBy={me}
choices.C: Edit the incident layout to add a new button that calls the AssignAnalystToIncident automation with argument owner={me}
choices.A: Edit the incident layout to add a new button that calls the AssignAnalystToIncident automation with no argument
choices.D: Edit the incident layout to add a new button that calls the AssignAnalystToIncident automation with argument assignBy=current

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct the argument assignBy= 
"top-user: The user that is most commonly owns this type of incident.
less-busy-user: The less busy analyst will be picked to be the incident owner.
online: The analyst is picked randomly from all online analysts
current: The user that executed the command."
Since assigntome automation's button does not have any arguments, the proper answer would be assignanalysttoincident script with assignby=current argument. Thus, answer will be D.
All wrong. Edit layout, add new button, click on it and select a Button Script, search for AssignToMeButton and save it. That's it.

questions.question_text: A Cortex XSOAR Administrator is tasked with building a button for an analyst in order for the analyst to be assigned to the incident as an owner. What is the process?
Which field type should be used to hold more than 60,000 characters of unformatted text?

discussion.content:
In Settings >> Objects Setup >> New Incident Field >> Field Type >> Select from
Boolean, Date Picker, Grid (table) HTML, Long Text, Markdown, Multi-select/Array, number, role, Short Text, Tags, Timer/SLA, URL or user. In this instance, Short Text (maximum of 60,000 characters) does not suit so long text it is!

questions.question_text: Which two functions in XSOAR are incident types used for? (Choose two.)

choices.A: To run dedicated playbooks for different event types
choices.D: To facilitate role based access to XSOAR incidents
choices.B: To classify events ingested from various sources into the relevant types
choices.C: To classify indicators extracted in XSOAR incidents to their respective types

questions.question_text: When creating an incident layout section, it is best to place long field values within which of the following?

discussion.content:
B. 
define section properties.You can determine how a section in the layout appears in the layout. For example, does the section include the section header or not. You can also configure the fields to appear in rows or as cards. For example, if you know that some of the field values will be very long, you are better off using rows. If you know that the field values are short, you might want to use cards so you can fit more fields in a section. If a field label is very long, you can select to wrap the label so that you can see the full name of the field.
